means: （陷入）心中无数的困境（或险境）

sentence.Network_en: It happened at Stamford Bridge one murky November afternoon.
sentence.Network_cn: 这发生在11月一个阴沉的下午，斯坦福德桥上。

sentence.Network_en: There has been a murky conspiracy to keep them out of power.
sentence.Network_cn: 有人策划了一个不可告人的阴谋要将他们排斥在权力中心之外。

sentence.Network_en: The law here is a little bit murky.
sentence.Network_cn: 此处的法律条文有点含糊不清。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 陷入心中无数的困境；落入心中无数的险境

entry.def: A murky place or time of day is dark and rather unpleasant because there is not enough light.

example.ex: The large lamplit room was murky with woodsmoke...
example.tran: 木柴冒出的烟把亮着灯的大房间弄得烟雾弥漫。

example.ex: It happened at Stamford Bridge one murky November afternoon.
example.tran: 这发生在11月一个阴沉的下午，斯坦福德桥上。

entry.def: Murky water or fog is so dark and dirty that you cannot see through it.

example.ex: ...the deep, murky waters of Loch Ness.
example.tran: 内斯湖幽深浑浊的湖水

entry.tran: 暧昧可疑的;不可告人的
entry.def: If you describe an activity or situation as murky, you suspect that it is dishonest or morally wrong.

example.ex: There has been a murky conspiracy to keep them out of power.
example.tran: 有人策划了一个不可告人的阴谋要将他们排斥在权力中心之外。

entry.tran: 含糊不清的;难以理解的
entry.def: If you describe something as murky, you mean that the details of it are not clear or that it is difficult to understand.

example.ex: The law here is a little bit murky...
example.tran: 此处的法律条文有点含糊不清。

example.ex: The origins of bull-riding, which serves no practical purpose, are murkier.
example.tran: 骑牛赛没有实际意义，其起源比较令人费解。

means.word_mean: 1. (of especially liquids) clouded as with sediment;
2. so shaded as to be dark or gloomy;

auth_sentence.content: The responsibilities of pharmacists in this regard are murky.
auth_sentence.res_content: The responsibilities of pharmacists in this regard are murky.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The responsibilities of pharmacists in this regard are murky.

auth_sentence.content: Such public location announcements get into murky privacy territory.
auth_sentence.res_content: Such public location announcements get into murky privacy territory.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Such public location announcements get into murky privacy territory.

auth_sentence.content: Then the murky water turned from grey to brown.
auth_sentence.res_content: Then the murky water turned from grey to brown.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then the murky water turned from grey to brown.

sentences.en: sharks lurking in the murky grey depths of the sea
sentences.cn: 潜伏在大海浑浊深处的鲨鱼

sentences.en: She threw it into the river’s murky depths.
sentences.cn: 她把它扔进了混浊的河水深处。

sentences.en: The truth about your murky past is safe with me—my lips are sealed.
sentences.cn: 有关你过去那些不光彩的事,我决不告诉别人。

means.word_mean: ( 陷入) 心中无数的困境( 或险境)

sentences.en: As I opened up the computer to try and fix the problem, I realized that I was getting into completely uncharted waters and considered whether to leave it to the experts.
sentences.cn: 当我打开电脑打算修理它时，我意识到这是一个自己一无所知的领域，于是我考虑要不要请专业人员帮我解决。
